description: London Overground improvements - including new trains - for Gospel Oak to Barking

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["From Monday 18 March, there will be a reduced weekday service between Gospel Oak and Barking. There will be a similar level of capacity on the line, but trains will not run as frequently."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

We are investing over £300m in 54 new, British built, state-of-the-art electric trains for London Overground. Delivery of these new electric trains has been delayed while the manufacturer, Bombardier Transportation, carries out further software development. The trains will be brought into use between Gospel Oak and Barking as soon as possible.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Four-car temporary service"}

Until the new trains are ready for use, four-car electric trains are running approximately every 30 minutes on weekdays between Gospel Oak and Barking. There s a similar level of capacity on the line (compared to January), but trains do not run as frequently.

See station travel options (below) for the times of trains for most of the day. First trains and trains after 22:00 run at slightly different times. Supplementary buses are an alternative option, alongside local bus routes.
Our train and full supplementary bus timetables are available here .
There may be further changes or closures at weekends.

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Travelling via Zone 1"}

If youregularly travel on the Gospel Oak to Barking route (more than five days over an eight week period), but change your journey due to the temporary timetable changes, you may be eligible for a refund of any additional charges if you travel via Zone 1.

If you regularly use Oyster or contactless, refunds will be made automatically within two weeks of travel as long as you use the same card or device for each journey. If you don't receive your automatic refund, contact us.
Contact us about Oyster refunds
Contact us about contactless refunds
If you use a paper season ticket, contact our customer services team. Call 0343 222 1234  ( charges apply ).

Paper tickets will also be accepted on local buses via any reasonable routes. Oyster and contactless users must validate their cards or devices and will be charged the appropriate fare for the route taken, but can claim a refund by contacting customer services.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Thank you to our customers"}
The Mayor has secured funding from Bombardier to support a month's free travel on the line once the new trains are fully introduced.
Thank you to our customers, who have shown great patience. We will keep you updated and share more information as soon as it becomes available.
